availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marcus Wimsatt (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and auctioneer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and auctioneer. Maryland native. Married to Elizabeth Blanford Wimstaff. Father of Sarah E. Wimsatt, Mary E. Wimsatt, Laura Wimsatt, Isabella Wimsatt. James K. Wimsatt, and Eliza Jane Wimsatt. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Retired merchant in Marion County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Auctioneer in Marion County in 1863. Auctioneer in Marion County in 1865.
